intro: Chrysaspis boissieri, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Mediterranean. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows as a shrub with woody stems and hairy leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy plant in temperate climates. Its ornamental value has made it a popular choice for garden cultivation in regions with suitable conditions.
